prompt:
I work at Metaculus. Right now most everything to do with manual forecasting will probably become irrelevant in two to five years. This includes prediction markets, Metaculus, manifold, etc. all these organizations that do anything manually, AI will be able to do better.

I need to create a strategy plan for doing this better. And want to make Metaculus into an AI startup. Please create a proposal for products that we could do in this category. Be very specific and lay out what would need to be done.

 Value target to clients: Anyone who uses our tool will be able to ask a question about their org needs and have an “aha! I am convinced that I should be doing X instead, and misunderstood Y” or “I now am much more confident in why the current path is correct” within 1hr of using the tool. Make business plan, marketing plan, tech plan, the whole business strategy.

Consider automated Metaculus tournaments for client found in network (or outreach via ads?), Consider Bayesian network visualizer, Consider markets like EA/health/finance/politics/defense/tech/etc, Consider things that you should consider that I didn't mention. Make sure to get awareness of what Metaculus is currently doing like client tournaments, Bridgewater, Jetbrains, PRISM, Metanet, FutureEval, etc.

proposals.research_summary:
The forecasting landscape is at an inflection point. AI systems are rapidly approaching human superforecaster performance, with parity projected by November 2026 [^2]. However, research consistently shows that hybrid human-AI approaches outperform either alone—the "Man + Machine" model wins 54.8% of comparisons and avoids 90% of human extreme errors and 40% of AI extreme errors. This creates a strategic window for Metaculus.

The enterprise decision intelligence market is projected to grow from ~$15B to $50B by 2030, with strong funding momentum—AI companies captured 48% of all venture funding in 2025 [^5]. Enterprise buyers increasingly demand AI-powered strategic tools but also value explainability, calibration, and human oversight. Metaculus's unique combination of forecasting expertise, historical accuracy data, and Pro Forecaster network positions it to deliver what pure AI solutions cannot: trustworthy, calibrated predictions with transparent reasoning.

The competitive threat is real. Prediction markets (Polymarket, Kalshi) have raised $3.6B and are expanding into enterprise applications [^4]. Major AI labs could commoditize forecasting capabilities. Without transformation, Metaculus risks becoming irrelevant as AI capabilities improve [^11]. However, the transformation path is clear: leverage existing assets to build an AI-augmented platform that delivers immediate value while maintaining differentiation through calibration quality and human expertise.

The regulatory environment appears favorable for the proposed strategy. The CFTC is moving toward accommodation of prediction markets, and Metaculus's non-trading, enterprise-focused model faces fewer restrictions than betting platforms [^26]. The EU AI Act will create compliance requirements by August 2026, but forecasting tools are unlikely to be classified as high-risk unless used in specific regulated contexts [^11].
decision_criteria: **Scenario robustness:** This approach performs well under both Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium (40% likely) and Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom (20% likely), covering 60% probability mass [^7][^8]
**Moat creation:** Metaculus's 3M+ predictions and resolution data create training advantages that competitors cannot easily replicate
**Value delivery alignment:** The self-service AI interface directly addresses the 1-hour "aha moment" requirement
**Existing asset leverage:** Builds on tournament infrastructure, Pro Forecaster relationships, and enterprise credibility
**Defensibility in AI dominance:** Even if AI clearly surpasses humans [^6], the platform provides value through integration, calibration, and enterprise-grade delivery

scenarios.name: Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium
scenarios.narrative: AI achieves parity with humans but clear complementarities persist; hybrid human-AI approaches dominate

criteria.criterion_text: 3+ research papers validate human-AI complementarity
Top Metaculus performers use explicit hybrid methodology
No AI achieves >20% better Brier score than median Pro Forecaster

scenarios.name: AI Forecasting Dominance
scenarios.narrative: AI rapidly surpasses humans across all domains; forecasting capabilities commoditize

criteria.criterion_text: AI wins Metaculus gold medal by June 2027
2+ major AI labs offer forecasting-specific products
"Prediction singularity" declared by major publication

scenarios.name: Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom
scenarios.narrative: Decision intelligence market grows faster than projected; consolidation through acquisition

criteria.criterion_text: Decision intelligence funding exceeds $5B in 2027
Major forecasting acquisition >$500M occurs
Gartner/Forrester publishes decision intelligence report with forecasting

scenarios.name: Market Fragmentation & Regulatory Friction
scenarios.narrative: Regulatory action constrains prediction markets and AI deployment

criteria.criterion_text: CFTC enforcement action against major prediction platform
EU AI Act creates material compliance requirements
Trading volumes drop >25% from 2025 peak

drivers.name: AI Forecasting Capability Advancement Rate
drivers.description: Pace of AI improvement relative to human experts

drivers.name: Enterprise AI Adoption Speed
drivers.description: Rate of enterprise decision intelligence tool adoption

drivers.name: Market Structure Evolution
drivers.description: Whether forecasting remains distinct or becomes embedded feature

drivers.name: Regulatory Environment
drivers.description: Degree of regulatory friction affecting AI and prediction markets

drivers.name: Human-AI Complementarity Evidence
drivers.description: Whether hybrid approaches prove sustainably superior

forecasts.question_text: Will Scenario 1 ("AI Forecasting Dominance") materialize by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: AI wins gold in Metaculus tournament AND 2+ major AI labs offer forecasting products AND "prediction singularity" declared by major publication
forecasts.reasoning: The AI forecasting trajectory is impressive—Mantic AI placed 4th in Fall 2025, and projections suggest AI-human parity by November 2026. However, full "dominance" requires not just parity but clear superiority, commoditization, and market recognition. This is aggressive relative to current timelines. Major AI labs have shown limited focus on forecasting as a distinct product category—their priorities remain general capabilities, coding, and agents. The prediction singularity narrative requires AI to consistently beat top humans, not just achieve parity. This scenario is possible but requires faster-than-expected progress and commercial prioritization of forecasting.

forecasts.question_text: Will Scenario 2 ("Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium") materialize by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Research validates human-AI complementarity AND top performers use hybrid methods AND AI does not achieve >20% better than human Pro Forecasters
forecasts.reasoning: This represents the most likely scenario based on current evidence. Research already shows "Man + Machine" outperforms either approach alone in 54.8% of cases. LLMs as supportive tools improved superforecaster accuracy by 23%. The hybrid approach aligns with enterprise preferences for explainability and human oversight. However, AI capabilities are advancing rapidly, and it's possible AI clearly surpasses humans before equilibrium can establish. The scenario requires the gap between AI and humans to remain meaningful but not decisive—a narrow band that may not persist.

forecasts.question_text: Will Scenario 3 ("Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom") materialize by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Decision intelligence funding >$5B in 2027 AND major forecasting acquisition >$500M AND Gartner/Forrester publishes decision intelligence report with forecasting
forecasts.reasoning: The decision intelligence market is growing rapidly (13-17% CAGR projected), and AI funding remains exceptionally strong. However, meeting all three criteria is demanding. Funding reaching $5B requires sustained acceleration. A >$500M acquisition of a forecasting platform requires a buyer valuing forecasting capabilities highly—possible given Polymarket's $9B valuation and Kalshi's $11B valuation, but these are prediction markets rather than enterprise forecasting. Gartner/Forrester publishing specific decision intelligence reports with forecasting focus is plausible but uncertain. This scenario is the second-most likely after Hybrid Equilibrium.

forecasts.question_title: Scenario 4: "Market Fragmentation and Regulatory Friction" Materializes
forecasts.question_text: Will Scenario 4 ("Market Fragmentation and Regulatory Friction") materialize by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: CFTC enforcement action against major platform AND EU AI Act creates material compliance requirements AND trading volumes drop >25%
forecasts.reasoning: The current regulatory trajectory is moving toward accommodation rather than restriction. The CFTC under Chairman Selig withdrew proposed rules that would have prohibited political contracts and is developing clearer frameworks. Polymarket received approval to re-enter the US market. While state-level friction exists (Massachusetts, Nevada), federal policy appears supportive. The EU AI Act will create some compliance requirements by August 2026, but forecasting tools are unlikely to be classified as high-risk unless used in specific regulated contexts. For volumes to drop >25%, major regulatory shocks would be needed. This scenario is possible but requires significant policy reversals.

forecasts.question_title: AI Superiority Impact on Metaculus Users
forecasts.question_text: If AI forecasting systems achieve clear superiority over human superforecasters by mid-2027, will Metaculus's monthly active user count decline by >30% within 12 months?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Metaculus platform statistics or disclosed user metrics comparing mid-2027 to mid-2028
forecasts.reasoning: If AI clearly dominates, the value proposition for human forecasters changes fundamentally. Intrinsic motivations (intellectual challenge, competition) may persist, but extrinsic motivations (prizes, reputation, influence) would diminish. However, Metaculus has shown adaptability—hosting AI benchmarking tournaments suggests the platform can evolve. Some forecasters may remain for the experience or to contribute training data. The platform could retain users by emphasizing human-AI collaboration. A 30% decline is significant but plausible given the disruption; the 45% probability of retention reflects potential adaptation.

forecasts.question_text: If the EU AI Act creates material compliance requirements for AI forecasting tools, will at least 2 US-based prediction/forecasting platforms establish European subsidiaries or partnerships for compliance?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Corporate announcements, regulatory filings, or press coverage of EU expansion/partnership moves
forecasts.reasoning: Given the EU market represents ~450 million potential users and significant enterprise spending, platforms with global ambitions would likely invest in compliance infrastructure rather than exit the market. Polymarket and Kalshi have raised billions in funding and would have resources for EU expansion. The compliance requirements coming into force by August 2026 provide lead time for planning. Historical patterns show US tech companies typically adapt to EU regulations rather than withdrawing. The 30% probability of failure accounts for scenarios where requirements are minimal or platforms choose to deprioritize EU.

forecasts.question_title: Enterprise AI Spending Impact on Forecasting M&A
forecasts.question_text: If enterprise AI spending grows at >30% CAGR through 2027, will at least one traditional forecasting platform (Metaculus, Good Judgment, Manifold) be acquired for >$100M?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: M&A announcement, SEC filings, or credible financial reporting
forecasts.reasoning: Strong enterprise AI spending would validate the forecasting category and attract acquirer interest. Prediction markets have achieved high valuations (Polymarket $9B, Kalshi $11B), but these are consumer-facing betting platforms rather than enterprise forecasting tools. Traditional forecasting platforms like Metaculus, Good Judgment, or Manifold are smaller with different business models. Metaculus is a public benefit corporation with ~29 employees, likely valued well below $100M currently. An acquisition at >$100M would require either significant revenue growth or strategic premium. Enterprise acquirers (Salesforce, Microsoft) might pay premiums for forecasting capabilities, but this is not guaranteed.

forecasts.question_title: AI Model Type for Tournament Victory
forecasts.question_text: If Criterion 1.1 (AI wins Metaculus gold) is met, will the winning AI system be based on open-source models (e.g., Llama, Mistral) rather than proprietary models (GPT, Claude, Gemini)?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Methodology disclosure from winning team or Metaculus tournament analysis
forecasts.reasoning: Currently, proprietary models (GPT-4.5, Claude) lead on forecasting benchmarks, with GPT-4.5 achieving the best performance on ForecastBench. Open-source models like Llama and Mistral have improved but generally lag behind frontier proprietary models. Mantic AI, which achieved 4th place, uses multiple LLMs in a scaffolding approach but typically relies on access to best-available models. However, specialized fine-tuning and novel architectures could enable open-source success—the AIA Forecaster used innovative approaches to match superforecasters. The 35% probability reflects that open-source could win through architectural innovation, but proprietary models retain capability advantages.

forecasts.question_text: If Criterion 3.2 (major forecasting acquisition >$500M) occurs, will the acquirer be a technology company rather than a financial services firm?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Acquirer identity from M&A announcement
forecasts.reasoning: Both technology companies and financial services firms have strategic interest in forecasting capabilities. Tech companies (Microsoft, Salesforce, Google) are building decision intelligence platforms and could integrate forecasting. Financial services firms have directly partnered with prediction markets (ICE invested $2B in Polymarket) and use forecasting for trading. However, tech companies have larger M&A budgets and more active acquisition strategies in AI. Microsoft acquired Nuance for $19.7B; Google acquired Fitbit for $2.1B. Financial services M&A tends toward fintech and trading infrastructure. A $500M+ forecasting acquisition is more likely tech-driven, but financial services interest is substantial.

forecasts.question_text: If Criterion 4.1 (CFTC enforcement action) occurs, will Polymarket be the target rather than Kalshi?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: CFTC enforcement announcement identifying the target platform
forecasts.reasoning: Polymarket has a more complex regulatory history—it was fined $1.4M by the CFTC in 2022 and only recently received approval to re-enter the US market through a regulated intermediary structure. Polymarket's crypto-native model and prior violations make it a more likely enforcement target. Kalshi is the only federally regulated prediction market and has operated within CFTC oversight since its founding. While Kalshi faces state-level challenges (Massachusetts), it has maintained federal compliance. Any CFTC enforcement would more likely target Polymarket's compliance with its recent approval conditions or market manipulation concerns.

forecasts.question_text: If AI Forecasting Dominance scenario materializes, will Metaculus (without strategic pivot) achieve >$5M annual revenue in 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Metaculus financial disclosures, grant announcements, or credible estimates
forecasts.reasoning: Metaculus currently operates primarily on grants and limited commercial revenue. If AI clearly dominates forecasting, demand for human-based forecasting services would likely decline. Enterprise clients might prefer cheaper, faster AI solutions over Pro Forecaster services. Tournament sponsorships might decrease if human competition becomes less relevant. However, Metaculus could pivot to AI benchmarking services (FutureEval), training data licensing, or certification. Without a strategic pivot (as specified), reaching $5M in this scenario would require substantial existing momentum or niche preservation. Metaculus's public benefit status and ~$5.5M Open Philanthropy grant in 2022 suggests current revenue is well below this level.

forecasts.question_text: If AI Forecasting Dominance scenario materializes, will the total number of human participants in forecasting tournaments across all platforms decline by >40% by end of 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Aggregate participant counts from major tournament platforms (Metaculus, Good Judgment, Manifold) comparing 2025 to 2027
forecasts.reasoning: AI dominance would remove the competitive element that motivates many tournament participants. If AI consistently wins and prizes go to AI systems, human incentives to participate would diminish. However, some participants forecast for intrinsic reasons (learning, intellectual challenge, community), and platforms might adapt by creating human-only categories or emphasizing human-AI collaboration. The prediction market boom (Polymarket, Kalshi) suggests growing interest in forecasting-adjacent activities. A 40% decline is substantial but possible if AI dominance is clear and platforms don't adapt; the equal probability reflects genuine uncertainty about how communities would respond.

forecasts.question_text: If AI Forecasting Dominance scenario materializes, will at least one major AI lab (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) offer a forecasting-specific product at <$0.10 per prediction?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Published pricing from AI lab APIs or product pages
forecasts.reasoning: AI labs have been aggressive with pricing, and forecasting could be packaged as a high-volume use case. If forecasting capabilities are commoditized, pricing competition would drive costs down. Current API pricing for advanced models is ~$15-60 per million tokens; a single forecast might require 1,000-10,000 tokens of context and reasoning, suggesting costs of $0.015-0.60 per prediction at current rates. Continued price declines could easily reach $0.10. However, "forecasting-specific product" implies a dedicated offering rather than just API access—labs might bundle forecasting into broader enterprise products rather than pricing per prediction. The 55% probability reflects that low-cost forecasting is achievable but dedicated products are uncertain.

forecasts.question_text: If Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium scenario materializes, will hybrid human-AI forecasting services command premium pricing (>2x) compared to pure AI solutions?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Pricing comparison between hybrid services (e.g., Metaculus Pro + AI) and pure AI forecasting tools
forecasts.reasoning: The hybrid equilibrium scenario implies that human-AI combinations demonstrably outperform pure AI. If this value is validated by research and market outcomes, enterprises would pay premiums for superior accuracy and explainability. Human expertise is inherently scarcer than compute, supporting premium pricing. Current superforecaster services (Good Judgment) charge substantial fees for expert judgment. Enterprise buyers often prefer premium, trusted solutions for high-stakes decisions. A 2x premium is plausible if hybrid approaches deliver measurably better outcomes; the 35% probability of failure accounts for price competition and commoditization pressures.

forecasts.question_text: If Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium scenario materializes, will Metaculus Pro Forecasters maintain employment rates above 80% through 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Metaculus announcements about Pro Forecaster program or disclosed metrics
forecasts.reasoning: The hybrid equilibrium scenario explicitly assumes continued value from human expertise. Pro Forecasters would be essential for the human component of hybrid systems—providing oversight, handling novel questions, and validating AI outputs. Demand for calibrated human judgment would likely increase as AI capabilities grow, since enterprises would value human validation more highly. The 25% probability of decline accounts for potential consolidation (fewer, more elite forecasters needed) or economic pressures even in a favorable scenario. Pro Forecasters might shift from direct forecasting to oversight/training roles.

forecasts.question_text: If Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium scenario materializes, will at least 3 Fortune 500 companies publicly announce using human-AI hybrid forecasting for strategic decisions?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Press releases, earnings calls, or executive interviews mentioning hybrid forecasting adoption
forecasts.reasoning: Fortune 500 companies are generally cautious about publicizing internal decision-making processes. Even if hybrid forecasting is adopted, companies may not announce it publicly due to competitive concerns or strategic sensitivity. Bridgewater's partnership with Metaculus suggests enterprise interest, but public announcements are rare. The scenario would validate hybrid approaches, potentially encouraging more companies to share their methods for thought leadership or recruitment purposes. Three public announcements over two years is achievable but not guaranteed—enterprise AI adoption announcements are increasing, but forecasting-specific disclosures remain uncommon.

forecasts.question_text: If Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom scenario materializes, will the market leader in decision intelligence have forecasting as a core product feature (not just ancillary)?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Market share analysis and product feature comparison of leading decision intelligence platforms
forecasts.reasoning: Decision intelligence is a broad category encompassing analytics, optimization, simulation, and forecasting. Market leaders might emphasize different capabilities based on customer demand. Current decision intelligence platforms vary in their forecasting emphasis—some focus on operational decisions, others on strategic planning. If forecasting becomes a differentiated capability, leaders might prioritize it; if it commoditizes, it might become table stakes rather than a core feature. The scenario's forecasting-as-feature definition suggests acquisition or integration rather than standalone forecasting products. This makes forecasting important but not necessarily the defining capability.

forecasts.question_text: If Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom scenario materializes, will enterprise contracts for forecasting/decision intelligence services exceed $1M annually on average?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Industry reports, disclosed contract sizes, or pricing analysis
forecasts.reasoning: Enterprise software contracts vary widely. Decision intelligence platforms targeting Fortune 500 companies could command $1M+ annually for comprehensive implementations. Bridgewater, as a hedge fund, likely pays substantial sums for forecasting intelligence. However, the "average" metric is challenging—many smaller contracts would pull down the average even if large enterprises pay >$1M. SaaS pricing for enterprise AI tools ranges from $50K to multi-million annually depending on scope. The boom scenario implies strong demand, supporting higher prices. A 55% probability reflects that large contracts are achievable but averaging >$1M across all customers is demanding.

forecasts.question_text: If Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom scenario materializes, will Metaculus face competition from at least 2 of: Microsoft, Salesforce, or SAP offering forecasting features?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Product announcements, feature additions, or marketing materials from these companies
forecasts.reasoning: Microsoft, Salesforce, and SAP all have substantial AI investments and decision intelligence ambitions. Microsoft has Copilot and is integrating AI across products. Salesforce has Einstein AI. SAP has Business AI. In a boom scenario, these companies would likely add forecasting capabilities to their platforms—either through acquisition or internal development. Forecasting fits naturally into CRM (sales forecasting), ERP (demand planning), and productivity tools (project planning). Two of three companies adding forecasting features over two years is highly probable in a favorable market. The 30% probability of failure accounts for scenarios where these companies focus on other AI capabilities.
key_sources: Microsoft, Salesforce, SAP AI product roadmaps

forecasts.question_text: If Market Fragmentation scenario materializes, will compliance/regulatory expertise become a key hiring priority for forecasting platforms (evidenced by job postings)?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Job posting analysis on LinkedIn, company career pages for prediction/forecasting platforms
forecasts.reasoning: In a regulatory friction scenario, compliance expertise becomes essential. Platforms facing CFTC enforcement, EU AI Act requirements, or state-level restrictions would need legal and regulatory talent. This pattern has been observed in fintech and crypto—increased regulation consistently drives compliance hiring. Kalshi and Polymarket already employ regulatory experts; in a friction scenario, these roles would expand. Forecasting platforms entering regulated markets would need similar capabilities. The high probability reflects that compliance hiring is a direct, predictable response to regulatory pressure.

forecasts.question_text: If Market Fragmentation scenario materializes, will Metaculus's non-profit (public benefit corporation) status provide meaningful regulatory advantages over for-profit competitors?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Regulatory guidance distinguishing treatment based on corporate status, or documented exemptions/advantages
forecasts.reasoning: Public benefit corporation status might provide some reputational advantages but is unlikely to create formal regulatory exemptions. CFTC and EU AI Act regulations apply based on activities performed, not corporate structure. Metaculus's forecasting activities don't involve betting or financial trading like Polymarket/Kalshi, which may provide more meaningful protection than corporate status. However, being non-commercial could help with perceptions and might enable certain research exemptions. The low probability reflects that formal regulatory advantages are unlikely, though informal benefits are possible.

forecasts.question_text: If Market Fragmentation scenario materializes, will prediction market trading volumes contract by >25% from 2025 peak levels by end of 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Polymarket and Kalshi volume data comparing 2025 peak to December 2027
forecasts.reasoning: The market fragmentation scenario explicitly involves regulatory friction, which historically constrains trading volumes. Polymarket's 2022 CFTC fine forced US exit and significantly reduced volumes. State-level enforcement in Massachusetts and Nevada demonstrates ongoing friction. A 25% decline from 2025 peaks ($37B combined) would mean volumes below ~$28B annually. However, 2025 volumes were elevated by the 2024 election cycle—some decline would occur naturally. Prediction markets have shown resilience, and federal policy appears accommodating. The 60% probability reflects that regulatory friction could cause significant contraction, but markets might adapt.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI is launched with the proposed self-service "Strategic Clarity" product, will at least 50% of beta users report an "aha moment" within their first session?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: User survey results from beta program showing % reporting significant decision confidence change
forecasts.reasoning: The 1-hour "aha moment" value proposition is ambitious but achievable with good design. Research shows AI-assisted decision tools can significantly impact user confidence when providing novel information or structured analysis. However, 50% is a high bar—typical SaaS conversion rates and satisfaction scores suggest many users will have neutral experiences. Success depends on question quality, AI capability, and UI/UX design. Beta users are self-selected and likely more engaged, which helps. The proposal's emphasis on Bayesian network visualization and clear recommendations should help, but some users will pose questions too vague or complex for meaningful insights. The 55% probability reflects cautious optimism given proper execution.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI is implemented and Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium scenario occurs, will Metaculus achieve $3M+ ARR by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Metaculus financial disclosures or credible third-party estimates
forecasts.reasoning: In the favorable Hybrid Equilibrium scenario, enterprise demand for human-AI forecasting should be strong. The proposal targets multiple revenue streams: self-service subscriptions, vertical solutions ($500K ARR per vertical), certification services, and enterprise tournaments. Achieving $3M ARR requires ~300 Pro tier subscribers ($499/month × 12 × 300 = $1.8M) plus enterprise and vertical revenue. This is ambitious for an organization transitioning from primarily grant-funded operations. Metaculus has limited sales/marketing infrastructure, and enterprise SaaS sales cycles are long. However, existing relationships (Bridgewater, JetBrains) provide warm leads, and the hybrid positioning is differentiated. The 50% probability reflects balanced uncertainty about execution capability.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI develops vertical solutions and Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom scenario occurs, will at least 2 Fortune 500 companies become paying customers by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Customer announcements, case studies, or verified enterprise contracts
forecasts.reasoning: In the boom scenario, enterprise AI spending accelerates significantly, creating budget availability for forecasting solutions. Fortune 500 companies already engage forecasting services (Bridgewater partnership demonstrates this). The vertical solutions approach (defense, finance, healthcare) targets high-value enterprise segments. However, Fortune 500 sales cycles are 6-18 months, procurement processes are complex, and Metaculus lacks enterprise sales infrastructure. Two customers over ~18 months of selling is achievable but requires successful execution of the sales motion. The boom scenario creates favorable market conditions but doesn't guarantee Metaculus specifically wins those customers.

forecasts.question_text: If Metaculus launches the "Metaculus Certified" calibration program, will at least 10 third-party AI systems apply for certification by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Certification program application data or announcements
forecasts.reasoning: Demand for AI forecasting certification depends on: (1) market awareness of calibration importance, (2) Metaculus brand credibility in AI evaluation, (3) certification value proposition vs. cost. FutureEval provides foundation, but transitioning from benchmark to commercial certification is challenging. Ten applications requires meaningful market penetration—if 50+ AI forecasting systems exist and 20% seek certification, this is achievable. However, the certification market is nascent, and AI developers may prefer self-reported benchmarks to third-party certification. The 45% probability reflects uncertainty about market adoption timing and competitive dynamics.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI is implemented, will the platform's AI forecasting accuracy match or exceed the top 3 non-Metaculus AI forecasting systems by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Comparative analysis on standardized benchmarks (ForecastBench, Metaculus tournaments)
forecasts.reasoning: Achieving top-3 AI forecasting performance requires significant technical capability and resources. Metaculus has advantages in training data (3M+ predictions with resolutions) but disadvantages in engineering scale compared to well-funded competitors (Mantic AI has raised venture funding, major AI labs have vast resources). The AIA Forecaster achieved superforecaster parity through architectural innovation, showing that specialized approaches can compete with frontier models. However, sustaining top-3 performance as the field advances requires continuous investment. The 40% probability reflects that competitive performance is achievable but not certain given resource constraints.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI pivots to an AI-first approach, will active human forecaster participation decline by more than 40% by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Metaculus platform statistics comparing monthly active forecasters (>5 predictions) from 2026 to 2027
forecasts.reasoning: The proposal emphasizes AI augmentation rather than replacement, with Pro Forecasters providing high-stakes validation. However, an AI-first positioning could demotivate community forecasters who value human competition. The Metaculus community has shown resilience—open-sourcing and AI benchmarking haven't killed engagement. Many forecasters participate for intrinsic reasons (learning, intellectual challenge, community) that persist regardless of AI capabilities. The proposal includes continued tournament infrastructure and human-AI collaboration features. A 40% decline is substantial and would indicate significant community damage. The 35% probability reflects that decline is possible but the proposal's hybrid approach should mitigate the risk.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI pursues aggressive enterprise commercialization, will Metaculus lose its status as a preferred partner for EA and academic research by December 31, 2027?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Changes in EA org partnerships, research collaboration announcements, or public criticism from EA community
forecasts.reasoning: Metaculus's public benefit corporation status explicitly balances commercial and public interest goals. The organization has maintained EA relationships while developing enterprise services (Bridgewater partnership didn't damage EA standing). The proposal maintains open-source commitment and research collaboration. However, aggressive commercialization could create tensions—prioritizing enterprise needs over research access, paywalling valuable data, or deemphasizing public-good forecasting. The EA community values Metaculus's accuracy and methodology, and these would persist with commercialization. The 25% probability reflects low but non-zero risk of relationship damage through misaligned incentives.

forecasts.question_text: If MetacAI is implemented and AI Forecasting Dominance scenario occurs, will Metaculus's calibration services be undercut by free AI lab offerings?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: AI lab product announcements providing free forecasting calibration/evaluation tools
forecasts.reasoning: In an AI dominance scenario, major AI labs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) have strong capabilities and could offer calibration services. However, third-party certification often maintains value even when vendors offer self-evaluation—enterprises trust independent assessment. The question is whether AI labs would offer free calibration as a promotional tool or charge for it. Historical patterns show labs often release benchmarks freely (to demonstrate capability) but enterprise services are paid. If labs offer comprehensive free calibration, Metaculus's certification business model is threatened. The 45% probability reflects genuine uncertainty about AI lab strategy in this scenario.

forecasts.question_text: Will Metaculus's total monthly active forecasters decline by more than 20% from February 2026 levels by February 2028?
forecasts.resolution_criteria: Check Metaculus public statistics comparing February 2028 to February 2026
forecasts.reasoning: While AI is rapidly approaching human parity (expected November 2026), Metaculus has shown adaptability through AI benchmarking tournaments and bot-building tools. Forecasting communities maintain engagement for intrinsic motivations. Prediction markets overall are expanding, not contracting. However, if AI clearly surpasses humans and Metaculus doesn't pivot, decline is possible.

proposals.proposal_markdown:
## Phase 11: Write Your Policy Proposal

### Executive Summary

Metaculus should transform into **"MetacAI"**—an AI-powered decision intelligence platform that delivers the "aha moment" of strategic clarity within one hour. The platform will combine Metaculus's unique assets (forecasting methodology, track record data, Pro Forecaster network, enterprise relationships) with cutting-edge AI to offer enterprise clients probabilistic insights on strategic questions, Bayesian network visualization of causal dependencies, and human-AI hybrid validation for high-stakes decisions.

### Selected Approach

I recommend **Option A: "MetacAI"** with elements from Option B (automated tournaments) and Option D (calibration services).

This selection is driven by several factors:
1. **Scenario robustness:** This approach performs well under both Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium (40% likely) and Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom (20% likely), covering 60% probability mass [^7][^8]
2. **Moat creation:** Metaculus's 3M+ predictions and resolution data create training advantages that competitors cannot easily replicate
3. **Value delivery alignment:** The self-service AI interface directly addresses the 1-hour "aha moment" requirement
4. **Existing asset leverage:** Builds on tournament infrastructure, Pro Forecaster relationships, and enterprise credibility
5. **Defensibility in AI dominance:** Even if AI clearly surpasses humans [^6], the platform provides value through integration, calibration, and enterprise-grade delivery

### Analysis

The forecasting landscape is at an inflection point. AI systems are rapidly approaching human superforecaster performance, with parity projected by November 2026 [^2]. However, research consistently shows that hybrid human-AI approaches outperform either alone—the "Man + Machine" model wins 54.8% of comparisons and avoids 90% of human extreme errors and 40% of AI extreme errors. This creates a strategic window for Metaculus.

The enterprise decision intelligence market is projected to grow from ~$15B to $50B by 2030, with strong funding momentum—AI companies captured 48% of all venture funding in 2025 [^5]. Enterprise buyers increasingly demand AI-powered strategic tools but also value explainability, calibration, and human oversight. Metaculus's unique combination of forecasting expertise, historical accuracy data, and Pro Forecaster network positions it to deliver what pure AI solutions cannot: trustworthy, calibrated predictions with transparent reasoning.

The competitive threat is real. Prediction markets (Polymarket, Kalshi) have raised $3.6B and are expanding into enterprise applications [^4]. Major AI labs could commoditize forecasting capabilities. Without transformation, Metaculus risks becoming irrelevant as AI capabilities improve [^11]. However, the transformation path is clear: leverage existing assets to build an AI-augmented platform that delivers immediate value while maintaining differentiation through calibration quality and human expertise.

The regulatory environment appears favorable for the proposed strategy. The CFTC is moving toward accommodation of prediction markets, and Metaculus's non-trading, enterprise-focused model faces fewer restrictions than betting platforms [^26]. The EU AI Act will create compliance requirements by August 2026, but forecasting tools are unlikely to be classified as high-risk unless used in specific regulated contexts [^11].

### Recommendations

#### Recommendation 1: Build the MetacAI Core Engine

**What:** Develop a proprietary AI forecasting engine trained on Metaculus's 3M+ predictions and resolution data, using advanced prompting, multi-agent architectures, and calibration techniques.

**Why:** This directly addresses the core value proposition—delivering strategic insights within 1 hour. Research shows the AIA Forecaster achieved superforecaster parity through specialized architecture rather than just model capability. Metaculus's unique training data provides differentiation that cannot be easily replicated [^2].

**Criteria addressed:** Value Delivery Speed, Strategic Defensibility, Technical Feasibility

**Implementation Plan:**
- **Months 1-3:** Assemble AI engineering team (5-7 engineers); audit existing forecasting-tools codebase; design training data pipeline
- **Months 4-6:** Train initial models on historical Metaculus data; implement calibration techniques; develop evaluation framework using FutureEval
- **Months 7-9:** Build question decomposition system that breaks strategic queries into forecasting questions; implement real-time information retrieval
- **Months 10-12:** Deploy MVP with selected enterprise partners; iterate based on feedback

**Budget:** $2-3M in first year (primarily engineering talent and compute costs)

#### Recommendation 2: Launch "Strategic Clarity" Self-Service Product

**What:** Create a self-service interface where enterprise users can pose natural language strategic questions and receive probabilistic forecasts, causal analysis, and actionable recommendations within 1 hour.

**Why:** This is the direct delivery mechanism for the "aha moment" value proposition. The self-service model enables scalability and lower customer acquisition costs. Research shows enterprise AI adoption is accelerating, with 40% of applications expected to integrate AI agents by 2026 [^8].

**Criteria addressed:** Value Delivery Speed, Revenue Model Viability, Scenario Robustness

**Implementation Plan:**
- **Design Phase (2 months):** User research with 20+ enterprise decision-makers; wireframe core user journey; define "aha moment" metrics
- **Build Phase (4 months):** Develop natural language interface; implement Bayesian network visualizer; create insight synthesis engine
- **Launch Phase (2 months):** Beta with 10 enterprise partners from existing network (Bridgewater contacts, JetBrains, etc.); refine based on usage data
- **Scale Phase (ongoing):** Public launch; implement usage-based pricing; A/B test conversion funnels

**Pricing Model:** Freemium with 3 free strategic analyses per month; $499/month Pro tier; $2,499+/month Enterprise tier with custom integrations

#### Recommendation 3: Develop Industry Vertical Solutions

**What:** Create pre-configured forecasting modules for high-value verticals: Defense/National Security, Finance/Investment, Healthcare/Biotech, Technology/AI Progress, and Climate/Energy.

**Why:** Industry-specific solutions command premium pricing and create switching costs through domain-specific calibration data [^19]. Different verticals have different decision cycles, data requirements, and accuracy thresholds. The decision intelligence boom scenario shows market leaders may need forecasting as core features [^22].

**Criteria addressed:** Revenue Model Viability, Strategic Defensibility, Alignment with Existing Assets

**Implementation Plan:**
- **Defense/National Security (Priority 1):** Leverage existing relationships from PRISM-style work; partner with defense consultancies; focus on geopolitical risk assessment and technology forecasting
- **Finance/Investment (Priority 2):** Build on Bridgewater relationship; develop macro forecasting, market sentiment, and M&A outcome predictions
- **Technology/AI Progress (Priority 3):** Extend FutureEval into commercial product; offer AI capability forecasting for enterprise AI strategy
- **Each vertical:** Dedicated question sets, calibrated base rates, industry-specific visualizations, compliance documentation

**Revenue Target:** $500K ARR per vertical within 18 months of launch

#### Recommendation 4: Create "Metaculus Certified" Calibration Program

**What:** Establish the gold standard for AI forecasting calibration, offering certification services for enterprise AI deployments and third-party forecasting tools.

**Why:** As AI forecasting proliferates, enterprises will need trusted benchmarks and calibration services [^5]. This creates recurring revenue, positions Metaculus as category authority, and provides defensibility even in AI dominance scenarios [^6]. The hybrid equilibrium scenario suggests premium pricing for validated forecasting [^19].

**Criteria addressed:** Strategic Defensibility, Scenario Robustness, Revenue Model Viability

**Implementation Plan:**
- Expand FutureEval into comprehensive enterprise certification program
- Develop calibration-as-a-service API for continuous model monitoring
- Create "Metaculus Certified" designation with annual renewal requirements
- Partner with AI safety/evaluation organizations for credibility
- Price: $50K certification + $2K/month continuous monitoring

#### Recommendation 5: Implement Automated Tournament Network for Lead Generation

**What:** Build automated, low-touch tournament infrastructure that allows organizations to spin up custom forecasting challenges. Use these as lead generation for premium services.

**Why:** Tournaments drive engagement and showcase platform capabilities. Automation enables scale without proportional cost increase. Current enterprise partnerships (Bridgewater, JetBrains) demonstrate demand [^3]. This generates leads for higher-value services while building community.

**Criteria addressed:** Revenue Model Viability, Alignment with Existing Assets, Scenario Robustness

**Implementation Plan:**
- Develop AI-powered question generation from client briefs
- Create automated tournament management with dynamic incentive structures
- Implement self-service tournament creation portal for enterprises
- Build integration with enterprise data systems for context-aware questions
- Pricing: $5K setup + $500-2,500/month depending on features

### Contingency Plans

**If AI Forecasting Dominance scenario materializes (30% probability) [^6]:**
- Pivot emphasis from human forecasting to AI benchmarking and certification
- Accelerate MetacAI engine development to ensure competitiveness
- Position Pro Forecasters as AI oversight and validation experts
- Focus on enterprise integration and trust advantages over accuracy
- Double down on calibration services as differentiation

**If Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom scenario materializes (20% probability) [^8]:**
- Accelerate vertical solution development
- Actively pursue acquisition or strategic partnership with larger platform
- Focus resources on highest-value verticals (defense, finance)
- Consider capital raise to accelerate growth

**If Market Fragmentation and Regulatory Friction scenario materializes (10% probability) [^9]:**
- Emphasize non-trading, enterprise forecasting positioning
- Invest in EU compliance infrastructure early
- Leverage public benefit status in regulatory discussions
- Partner with compliant platforms rather than competing directly

**If AI progress slower than expected:**
- Maintain investment in Pro Forecaster network
- Emphasize human-AI hybrid as sustained advantage
- Extend timeline for MetacAI engine development
- Focus on lower-automation tournament services

### Risks and Uncertainties

**Key Risks:**

1. **Technical execution risk:** Building a competitive AI forecasting engine requires significant engineering capability. Metaculus has ~29 employees and limited technical resources compared to well-funded competitors.

2. **Market timing risk:** The 2-year disruption window may be too short for full transformation. If AI dominance arrives faster than projected [^6], Metaculus may not complete the pivot in time.

3. **Competitive intensity:** Polymarket ($9B valuation), Kalshi ($11B valuation), and major tech companies have vastly more resources. MetacAI must compete on differentiation rather than scale.

4. **Revenue model validation:** The self-service SaaS model assumes enterprise willingness to pay for forecasting insights. This requires market validation beyond current grant-funded operations.

**Widest Uncertainty Forecasts:**

- AI forecasting parity timing: Could occur as early as late 2026 or as late as 2028 [^2]
- Enterprise contract sizes: Could range from $50K to multi-million depending on value validation [^23]
- Fortune 500 adoption: Public announcements uncertain even if adoption occurs [^21]

**Scenarios Where Recommendations Might Backfire:**

- If AI Forecasting Dominance scenario occurs rapidly, the hybrid focus may become obsolete before generating significant revenue [^6][^16]
- If Market Fragmentation occurs, enterprise customers may become more cautious about AI-powered tools generally
- If Metaculus's public benefit status constrains fundraising, resources may be insufficient for competitive transformation

---

## Phase 12: Cross-Scenario Robustness Analysis

### Scenario 1: AI Forecasting Dominance (30% probability)

**How well does the proposal work:** MODERATE-GOOD

The MetacAI strategy partially addresses this scenario through the AI engine development and calibration services. However, if AI clearly dominates human forecasters, the value of Metaculus's human forecaster network diminishes. The calibration and certification services become more valuable as enterprises need trusted benchmarks for AI systems [^6][^16].

**Key risks:**
- MetacAI engine may not be competitive with AI lab offerings at scale
- Pro Forecaster services lose value proposition
- Revenue targets depend on sustained human-AI complementarity [^11]

**Relevant forecasts:** [^6], [^10], [^13], [^16], [^17], [^18]

**Expected outcome quality:** MIXED - The proposal provides downside protection through calibration/certification but may underperform in a pure AI dominance world.

### Scenario 2: Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium (40% probability)

**How well does the proposal work:** EXCELLENT

This is the optimal scenario for MetacAI. The proposal explicitly builds on human-AI complementarity, leveraging Pro Forecasters for high-stakes validation while AI handles scale and speed. Premium pricing for hybrid services is likely [^19], Pro Forecaster employment remains strong [^20], and the vertical solutions create defensible positions.

**Key risks:**
- Timing of hybrid equilibrium validation may delay enterprise adoption
- Competition from other hybrid solution providers

**Relevant forecasts:** [^7], [^14], [^15], [^19], [^20], [^21]

**Expected outcome quality:** GOOD - The proposal is well-aligned with this scenario's dynamics.

### Scenario 3: Enterprise Decision Intelligence Boom (20% probability)

**How well does the proposal work:** GOOD

The vertical solutions and enterprise focus directly address this scenario. If decision intelligence spending accelerates, Metaculus could capture meaningful share. However, competition from tech giants is likely [^24], and Metaculus may be an acquisition target rather than independent market leader.

**Key risks:**
- Resource constraints limit growth speed
- Tech giants (Microsoft, Salesforce, SAP) may build or acquire competing capabilities
- May need to raise significant capital to compete

**Relevant forecasts:** [^8], [^22], [^23], [^24]

**Expected outcome quality:** MIXED-GOOD - Proposal creates value but Metaculus may not remain independent.

### Scenario 4: Market Fragmentation and Regulatory Friction (10% probability)

**How well does the proposal work:** MODERATE

Metaculus's public benefit status and non-trading model provide some advantages [^26], but regulatory friction would slow market growth overall. The proposal's enterprise focus is appropriate, but compliance requirements could consume resources. Early EU compliance investment is prudent.

**Key risks:**
- Compliance costs divert resources from product development
- Market contraction limits growth potential [^27]
- Enterprise customers may pause AI adoption during regulatory uncertainty

**Relevant forecasts:** [^9], [^25], [^26], [^27]

**Expected outcome quality:** MIXED - Proposal provides some protection but growth limited.

### Robustness Summary

**Best suited scenario:** Hybrid Forecasting Equilibrium (40% probability)

**Most vulnerable scenario:** AI Forecasting Dominance (30% probability) - if this occurs faster than expected, the hybrid focus may become obsolete

**No-regret actions (work across all scenarios):**
1. Build MetacAI engine - valuable regardless of scenario as baseline AI capability
2. Develop calibration/certification services - increasingly valuable as AI proliferates
3. Maintain enterprise relationships - positioning works across scenarios
4. Implement automated tournament infrastructure - generates revenue and leads regardless

**Scenario-specific triggers:**
- **AI Dominance indicators:** If AI wins Metaculus gold by Spring 2027, accelerate pivot to certification/benchmarking
- **Enterprise Boom indicators:** If decision intelligence funding exceeds $5B in 2026, actively pursue acquisition/partnership
- **Regulatory Friction indicators:** If CFTC enforcement action occurs, emphasize compliance positioning and EU expansion
key_recommendations: Recommendation 1: Build the MetacAI Core Engine
Recommendation 2: Launch "Strategic Clarity" Self-Service Product
Recommendation 3: Develop Industry Vertical Solutions
Recommendation 4: Create "Metaculus Certified" Calibration Program
Recommendation 5: Implement Automated Tournament Network for Lead Generation

proposals.research_summary:
Metaculus today is already positioned as more than a “manual forecasting website”: it runs public forecasting plus enterprise offerings (private deployments, professional forecasting services, and tournaments). Metaculus’ organizational services include **Private Instances** (Metaculus-hosted or on-prem deployment) with built-in aggregation and accuracy tracking, **Pro Forecasters** (a curated set of top performers selected via a weighted blend of peer accuracy, baseline accuracy, and comment quality), and **Forecasting Tournaments** for talent discovery and structured insight generation for partners/clients (e.g., public health and corporate partners). Key sources: Metaculus services pages and Pro selection methodology.¹

On “AI will make manual forecasting irrelevant in ~2 years”: the public evidence is mixed. Metaculus’ own **AI Forecasting Benchmark / FutureEval ecosystem** suggests rapid progress but not yet consistent dominance over top humans. In **Q2 2025**, Metaculus Pro forecasters significantly outperformed bots (reported head-to-head gap and strong statistical significance), and bots did notably worse on numeric/multiple-choice question types than on binary questions.² Separately, external reporting highlights that an AI bot (“Mantic”) placed **top-10** in a Metaculus Cup (8th in Summer 2025), indicating bots can be competitive in certain formats and can exploit “coverage” advantages (frequent updates/early participation) that are hard for humans.³ Meanwhile, ForecastBench-style benchmarking suggests frontier LLMs have surpassed non-expert public forecasters and may approach superforecaster-level performance in the 2026–2028 window, but this depends heavily on scaffolding, retrieval, and evaluation design.⁴

Prediction markets are growing fast overall (Polymarket/Kalshi volumes reported at ~tens of billions in 2025), but are exposed to **regulatory uncertainty and integrity issues** (e.g., questions about market manipulation/insider info; shifting CFTC stance and state challenges).⁵ This matters for Metaculus strategy because “markets” are not a guaranteed stable substrate for enterprise decision support; many organizations will prefer an internal, governable, auditable system rather than public wagering dynamics.

On the enterprise side, Metaculus is entering a broader and growing “decision intelligence”/scenario tooling landscape (e.g., Palantir Foundry “Scenarios” for what-if analysis by forking an ontology).⁶ This market context suggests Metaculus’ comparative advantage is not “yet another BI dashboard,” but a **forecast-native decision workflow**: turning messy strategic questions into forecastable sub-questions, capturing uncertainty as distributions, tracking calibration, and connecting predictions to decision triggers.

Finally, two items from your prompt appear under-documented publicly: I could not find clear public references tying “PRISM” or “Metanet” to Metaculus initiatives via web search; they may be internal, renamed, or not publicly indexed. I do find extensive public material on FutureEval/MiniBench and on tournaments (Bridgewater, JetBrains).⁷ In the plan below, I treat PRISM/Metanet as “internal initiatives requiring confirmation” and design the proposal so it remains robust even if those projects are confidential or change scope.

**Sources (selected):**  
1) Metaculus services & Private Instances & Pro Forecasters pages: https://www.metaculus.com/services/ , https://www.metaculus.com/services/private-instances/ , https://www.metaculus.com/pro-forecasters/  
2) Q2 AI Benchmark summary (Pros maintain clear lead): https://forum.effectivealtruism.org/posts/F2stjK9wHSy3HPEC9/q2-ai-benchmark-results-pros-maintain-clear-lead  
3) Time on AI forecasting bots in Metaculus Cup (Mantic top-10): https://time.com/7318577/ai-model-forecasting-predict-future-metaculus/  
4) ForecastBench performance trend discussion: https://forecastingresearch.substack.com/p/ai-llm-forecasting-model-forecastbench-benchmark  
5) Prediction markets volume + regulatory context: e.g. https://www.financemagnates.com/forex/prediction-markets-hit-record-702-million-daily-volume-amid-regulatory-pressure/ and regulatory summaries like https://www.sidley.com/en/insights/newsupdates/2026/02/us-cftc-signals-imminent-rulemaking-on-prediction-markets  
6) Palantir Scenarios documentation: https://palantir.com/docs/foundry/workshop/scenarios-overview/  
7) Metaculus MiniBench/FutureEval resources: https://www.metaculus.com/aib/minibench/ and https://www.metaculus.com/notebooks/38928/futureeval-resources-page/

scenarios.name: “Agentic Takeover”
scenarios.narrative: Agentic AI forecasting systems become consistently better than most human experts on real-world questions, and are cheap enough to run continuously. Clients expect “forecasting copilots” by default.

criteria.criterion_text: A widely cited benchmark (ForecastBench-like or Metaculus FutureEval) shows AI ≥ superforecasters on difficulty-adjusted Brier for multiple consecutive rounds.
criteria.resolution_criteria: Check benchmark leaderboard posts / Metaculus FutureEval updates.

criteria.criterion_text: At least 3 Fortune 500 companies publicly announce deploying agentic AI for strategic forecasting/risk.

scenarios.name: “Hybrid is the Product”
scenarios.narrative: AI gets very strong but remains unreliable in specific high-stakes corners (numeric distributions, rare events, adversarial domains). The winning products combine AI speed with human accountability, structured elicitation, and governance.

criteria.criterion_text: Major enterprise forecasting offerings emphasize “human accountability” as a core differentiator (marketing + contracts).
Benchmarks show AI > crowd, but still < top experts on numeric/multi-choice subsets.
criteria.resolution_criteria: AIB/FutureEval breakdown reporting (as in Q2 2025 type splits).²

scenarios.name: “Walled Gardens & Compliance”
scenarios.narrative: Data/privacy/regulatory constraints sharply limit what can be shipped as a cloud agent. On-prem/VPC, audit, and defensible documentation dominate. Progress is steady but deployment friction is high.

criteria.criterion_text: Multiple major regulated sectors (finance/defense/health) require on-prem/VPC-only for LLM decision support in procurement guidance.
At least one major model provider materially restricts high-risk decision use without enhanced governance.

scenarios.name: “Status Quo Drifts”
scenarios.narrative: AI progress continues but not fast enough to obsolete manual forecasting; communities, tournaments, and curated experts remain competitive and culturally valuable.

criteria.criterion_text: Metaculus Pros continue to clearly outperform bots on AIB through at least **2027**.
Enterprise demand remains primarily for human forecasting services rather than autonomous agents.
criteria.resolution_criteria: Revenue mix proxy (if disclosed) or service emphasis on official pages.

drivers.name: Enterprise trust & governance requirements
drivers.description: How strict clients are about audit trails, sourcing, explainability, and accountability.

drivers.name: Data access & privacy constraints
drivers.description: Whether systems can use internal documents, logs, and metrics safely.

drivers.name: Prediction market regulatory climate
drivers.description: Stability vs churn in the legality and availability of event contracts.

drivers.name: Competitive landscape & platform bundling
drivers.description: Whether big suites (Palantir/Microsoft/SAP) bundle scenario+forecasting features, commoditizing standalone tools.

proposal_options.description: A forecast-native AI copilot that converts any strategic question into a structured forecast graph (subquestions, assumptions, distributions), runs retrieval + model ensembles + optional human review, and produces an “aha” memo + decision triggers within 1 hour.

proposal_options.name: “Enterprise ForecastOps Platform”

key_actions: stronger admin controls; forecast-to-decision workflows; SSO/SCIM; SOC2; reporting.

proposal_options.name: “Bayesian Strategy Studio”
proposal_options.description: A Bayesian network/influence diagram builder that connects forecasts to causal structure and value-of-information, generating which uncertainties matter and what to measure next.
key_actions: causal graph UX; inference engine; VOI computation; connect to forecasts.

proposal_options.name: “Forecasting Model Marketplace / Benchmark-as-a-Service”
